intro: Talauma andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman skyflower, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
